title: Rotational KE - cylinder up rough and smooth ramps

content.prompt: A cylinder rolling across a horizontal surface travels up a ramp without slipping. The cylinder momentarily comes to rest at a height h0 above the horizontal surface before rolling back down. If there was negligible friction between the ramp and the cylinder, how would the maximum height of the cylinder compare to h0? What reasoning best supports the stated comparison?

choices.label: It is the same as h0. The gravitational force on the cylinder does the same amount of work.
It is the same as h0. The initial total kinetic energy is still converted to gravitational potential energy.
It is less than h0. The initial translational kinetic energy does not get converted to gravitational potential energy.
It is less than h0. The initial rotational kinetic energy does not get converted to gravitational potential energy.

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
